Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பகைபாவம் அச்சம் பழியென நான்கும்இகவாவாம் இல்லிறப்பான் கண்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Hatred, sin, fear, disgrace; these four will never leave him who goes in to his neighbour's wife.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A man is shown transgressing into his neighbor's house for an illicit affair.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The moment he commits the act, four menacing, spectral figures materialize and permanently attach themselves to him like ghostly chains or shadows.
Layered_Composition.Background: The four figures are distinct personifications: a furious, red figure of Hatred ('பகை'); a dark, heavy, sin-laden figure of Sin/Guilt ('பாவம்'); a trembling, grey figure of Fear ('அச்சம்'); and a mocking, mud-spattered figure of Disgrace ('பழி'). These four will now never leave him ('இகவாவாம்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The act of adultery instantly and permanently saddles the sinner with four inseparable companions: Hatred, Sin, Fear, and Disgrace.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of the four consequences as inescapable, haunting companions is the core of the image. Each specter has a design that reflects its nature. They are not just feelings, but active, tormenting entities.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dark, dramatic, and fearful light. Each of the four spectral companions glows with its own sickly, malevolent color—angry red, sinful black, fearful grey, and shameful brown—which combine to cast a chaotic and hellish light on the protagonist.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that captures the sinner being permanently shackled to his four new, terrifying companions.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with terrifying and distinct designs for the four personified consequences.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Chaotic, multi-source lighting from the four specters.
